attributes.description: Defines the optimal airflow capacity of the unit, ensuring efficient ventilation throughout the aircraft cabin. The range is calibrated for diverse flight altitudes.
attributes.name: airFlowRate

attributes.description: Specifies the ideal operating temperature range to ensure reliable performance under various in-flight thermal conditions.
attributes.name: operatingTemperature

attributes.description: Indicates the pressure compatibility of the unit to maintain integrated operation with the cabin's environmental control systems.
attributes.name: operatingPressure

attributes.description: Describes the maximum sound level output of the AHU, crucial for maintaining passenger comfort and reducing in-flight noise pollution.
attributes.name: noiseLevel

attributes.description: Specifies the recommended inspection and maintenance intervals to uphold system safety and operational reliability.
attributes.name: maintenanceInterval

designScenario.description: The Air Handling Unit (AHU) is a pivotal subsystem within the aircraft's Environmental Control System (ECS). It is engineered to condition, filter, and distribute air efficiently across various cabin zones. The design leverages modern aerospace technology including high-efficiency airflow management, real-time monitoring via embedded sensor networks, and modular subcomponents to allow for rapid diagnostics, maintenance, and scalability. The AHU is capable of operating in extreme environments, ensuring that passengers experience a consistently comfortable cabin atmosphere despite external flight conditions.
designScenario.name: Air Handling Unit

details.description: The AHU shall deliver a continuous and adjustable airflow between 600 and 2500 CFM ensuring proper cabin ventilation under all flight conditions.
The unit must maintain operational stability and performance within a temperature range of 5째C to 45째C, securing efficiency in varying environmental conditions.
An integrated multi-stage filtration system, including HEPA and activated carbon filters, shall remove particulates and chemical contaminants to uphold air quality and passenger health.
The system design must incorporate modular components with accessible interfaces, enabling quick replacement, maintenance, and potential upgrades without significant downtime.

relationships.description: The Air Handling Unit is composed of multiple integrated subcomponents that operate collectively to treat and distribute airflow.
The Ducting Network aggregates treated air and directs it uniformly through the cabin, forming an essential part of the AHU subsystem.
The HEPA Filter, a critical component for air purification, is composed within the AHU to ensure contaminant-free air supply.
The Signal Processing Module monitors sensor data from the AHU subcomponents to facilitate real-time adjustments and fault detection.
The Temperature Control System depends on the Air Handling Unit for the effective distribution of conditioned air required for thermal balance within the cabin.

systemComponents.description: The central subsystem responsible for processing, conditioning, and distributing ambient air throughout the cabin environment.
systemComponents.name: Air Handling Unit

subComponents.description: A high-capacity fan assembly designed to generate and maintain the necessary airflow pressure for optimal cabin ventilation.
subComponents.name: High-Efficiency Fan

subComponents.description: A network of air ducts engineered to guide and distribute conditioned air uniformly across diverse cabin zones.
subComponents.name: Ducting Network

subComponents.description: An advanced HEPA filtration module intended to remove particulate matter and airborne pathogens, ensuring a healthy cabin environment.
subComponents.name: HEPA Filter

subComponents.description: A dedicated signal processing unit that gathers real-time data from sensors embedded in the AHU, enabling predictive diagnostics and adaptive control.
subComponents.name: Signal Processing Module

constraints.name: Air Filter Efficiency Constraint
constraints.specification: Air filter system must achieve a minimum efficiency of 90% particulate removal.

requirements.name: Cabin Air Quality Requirement
requirements.text: Ventilation system shall purify incoming air to meet cabin environmental standards.

rag_context:
The Ventilation System includes the following components:
1. Air Filter System: Purifies incoming air in compliance with cabin environmental standards.
2. Fan Assemblies: Engineered for low noise and efficient air circulation.

The Ventilation System is a part of the Cabin Environmental Control System and is responsible for managing cabin ventilation and air quality.
